phrases.phrase: Convert XF1 movie threads to XF2 version
[OzzModz] TMDb Movie Thread Starter: Update watch provider data
[OzzModz] TMDb Movie Thread Starter: Check for Movie changes
For formatting old XF1 TMDb movie threads

Production results limit on thread view
Sync thread title with TMDb movie title
Items to show in forum thread list
Include release year in thread title
Select the user groups that will be able to manually update exisiting threads that DO NOT contain TMDb information.
Requires [OzzModz] Covers add-on installed. Select "none" to disable. The file size of the selected option must not exceed the max. file cover size.

If you are using your own CDN, enter the CDN path here.
Example: http://cdn.yourpath.com/data
DO NOT end the path with a /

Enter the ISO 639-1 Language Code that will be used for movie information.
These codes are available at List of ISO 639-1 codes

You may also include a two letter country code in the language selection (en-US, en-GB, pt-PT, pt-BR, etc...).
This is a list of the two letter country codes: ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 Country Codes

NOTE: There is no guarantee that the translation to the language selected will be the proper translation. And there is no guarantee there will be a translation of a movie at The Movie Database. Those are both handled by The Movie Database and not translated by this add-on.

To place a redirect link to the main movie thread in all genre limited forums that a movie can belong to, check this box.
EXAMPLE: A movie is in these genres: Drama, Science Fiction, Thriller
A member posts the movie in the Science Fiction forum.
Redirect links will be placed in the Drama and Thriller forums.
NOTE: Forum genre limiting must be enabled for this to work
Enable this option if you want to receive a list of movie companies. Enabling it can slow down the thread creation process.
Enable this option if you want to receive a list of movie credits. Enabling it can slow down the thread creation process.
Enable this option if you want to receive a list of movie videos. Enabling it can slow down the thread creation process.

Check this box if you want to force any comments entered with a new movie thread to be posted as the second post in the new movie thread. NOTE: This does not change existing threads. This only affects the first post in a new movie thread.
Select the forums that will be used to post movie threads
Instead of using the TMDb cloud for poster images, you can use the poster images that are stored on your server. To use the images stored on your server, check this box.

Enter the ISO 639-1 Language Code that will be used for movie information.
These codes are available at List of ISO 639-1 codes

You may also include a two letter country code in the language selection (en-US, en-GB, pt-PT, pt-BR, etc...).
This is a list of the two letter country codes: ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 Country Codes

NOTE: There is no guarantee that the translation to the language selected will be the proper translation. And there is no guarantee there will be a translation of a movie at The Movie Database. Those are both handled by The Movie Database and not translated by this add-on.

Changing language will NOT change threads already posted. Only new threads will post in the new language.
Changing this value will only apply to new entries. Larger values will take up more space and take longer to download.
Check this box to allow normal threads to be posted in a movie forum.
Check this option if you want to display movie data in XF search/tag results.
Select the items to show in a movie thread.
Changing this value will only apply to new entries. Larger values will take up more space and take longer to resize.
Changing this value will only apply to new entries. Larger values will take up more space and take longer to resize.
Select the items to show in the forum thread list.
Enable if you want to keep track of the list of changed TVs to automatically apply rebuilding data. Note: This will overwrite all your manual edits if the TV has been updated.
You can query up to 14 days
Please note that TMDb changes are made by users and may not always correct.
Checking this box will enable manual updates for existing threads that DO NOT contain TMDb Movie information.

You can limit the type of movies posted in each forum to a specific genre. Check this box to enable this option. The genre for each forum is specified in Forums->Nodes. Click on the forum you wish to limit and select the genres you wish to allow in the forum.
Check this box to turn on the movie rating system.
Check this box to use your own CDN for all poster images. Your CDN must pick up images from your server's data/movies folder.

To include the year a movie was released in the thread title, check this box.
Example: Blended (2014)

Leave it empty to disable.
Phrases can be translated with "snog_movies_country.{countryCode}" key.
Options for the TMDb movie thread starter add-on
If you have already rated this movie, your current rating is shown

You can limit the movie type by genre in this forum.
If you select ALL then any movie genre will be allowed.
If you select any other genres then new threads for this forum will be limited to movies in those genres.
NOTE: If someone tries to post a movie in a genre that does not have a node assigned to it, then they will receive an error message stating that the genre is not allowed to be posted. So, if you decide to keep movie genres in separate forums, be sure to either create a forum for every genre listed or create one forum set to accept ALL genres. The ALL genre is the last to be considered for a new thread. That way, if someone tries to post a movie with a different genre for the node they are posting in, it will be automatically posted in the correct node without an error.
Change thread title to movie title
